--- title: "A Quarto Thesis Template for Bachelor and Diploma Projects at JKU" description: "I’m sharing a Quarto template I customized for my bachelor’s thesis at Johannes Kepler University Linz." author: - name: Abdoulie Jallow url: https://jallow-code.github.io/ date: 17 11 2024 date-format: medium categories: [Resources] # self-defined categories citation: url: https://jallow-code.github.io/posts/jku-thesis-template/ image: thesis_image.png draft: false # setting this to `true` will prevent your post from appearing on your listing page until you're ready! doc: pdf: "thesis_template.pdf" engine: knitr --- # Background This template is based on the [Masters/Doctoral Thesis, LaTeX Template, Version 2.5 (27 Aug 2017)](https://www.latextemplates.com/template/masters-doctoral-thesis), which [Eli Holmes](https://github.com/nmfs-opensci/quarto-thesis) updated for Quarto. I further modified the Quarto template to fulfill JKU's formal criteria for diploma theses. Using Quarto was motivated by the difficulties I had when writing my first bachelor thesis in Microsoft Word. The main difficulties were ensuring consistent citation formatting, text alignment, and maintaining a tidy version-controlled workflow. Quarto effectively addresses these challenges. Above all, it combines data analysis and documentation into one platform thereby improving reproducibility. # Installing the Template The GitHub repository for the Quarto thesis template can be found [here](https://github.com/jallow-code/jku-quarto-thesis). Follow these steps to install and use the template: ## 1. Clone the Template Navigate to the directory where you want to create your thesis files. Run the following command in a terminal to download the template and its associated folders: ::: {.cell} ```{.bash .cell-code} quarto use template jallow-code/jku-quarto-thesis ``` ::: You will be prompted to specify an empty directory name for the template files. Provide a name for the new directory, which will store your thesis files. ## 2. Render the Template Once the template is installed, change into the new directory: ::: {.cell} ```{.bash .cell-code} cd ``` ::: To generate the document, use the command: ::: {.cell} ```{.bash .cell-code} quarto render ``` ::: ### Troubleshooting Errors If you encounter the following error during rendering: ``` vbnet ERROR: compilation failed - missing packages (automatic install disabled) LaTeX Error: Something's wrong--perhaps a missing \item. See the LaTeX manual or LaTeX Companion for explanation. Type H for immediate help. ... l.872 \end{CSLReferences} ``` This error is likely due to outdated versions of Quarto or TinyTeX. To resolve it: - Update your [TinyTex installation](https://yihui.org/tinytex/). - Ensure you are using the latest version of Quarto. # Using the Template with an Existing Document To use this template with an existing Quarto project, make sure you have all the required LaTeX folders as described above. Then, run: ::: {.cell} ```{.bash .cell-code} quarto install extension jallow-code/jku-quarto-thesis ``` ::: # Basic Usage and Customization ## Thesis Type and Frontmatter The template is configured for a Bachelor’s thesis by default. To change this, edit the `_quarto.yml` file. For example: ``` yaml thesis: type: Bachelor Thesis # Or "Master Thesis", "Doctoral Dissertation", etc. degree-name: Bachelor of Science group: Biological Chemistry # name of your study program supervisor: primary: "Assoz. Univ.-Prof. Dr. Ian Teasdale" co: "Dipl.-Ing. Michael Kneidinger" university: Johannes Kepler Universität Linz department: Institute of Polymer Chemistry faculty: Faculty of Engineering and Natural Sciences ``` You can also customize elements of the front matter (e.g., acknowledgments, dedication) by commenting out or modifying the respective sections in`_quarto.yml`. For instance, to exclude the dedication page: ``` yaml # dedication: "Frontmatter/dedication.tex" ``` ## Adding Symbols or Abbreviations The `Frontmatter` folder contains LaTeX files for abbreviations, symbols, and other sections. If needed, search online for LaTeX code examples to add symbols or format abbreviations. # Citation Styling The default citation style is `nature-chemistry.csl`. If you prefer another style, download it from the [Zotero Style Repository](https://www.zotero.org/styles?fields=chemistry) and update the `_quarto.yml` file: ``` yml bibliography: [example.bib] csl: your-preferred-style.csl ``` # Additional Resources - For detailed usage instructions, refer to the rendered sample PDF file below. - Explore the [Quarto technical writing documentation](https://quarto.org/docs/visual-editor/technical.html), especially if you are new to Quarto. - Watch Eli Holmes's [Youtube channel](https://www.youtube.com/@eeholmes-datascience4849) for insights into data science workflows and Quarto. # Sample Document ::: {.cell} ::: ```{=html}
